newsitem.title: NEPAL: Nepal, India officials discuss border dispute.
newsitem.headline: Nepal, India officials discuss border dispute.

text.p: Officials from Nepal and India began talks on Thursday to resolve a border dispute, Nepali Foreign Ministry officials said on Thursday.
They said the joint border committee meeting would discuss the delineation of the Himalayan kingdom's western border with India, which includes the disputed Kalapani area.

The dispute arose last year after Nepal and India signed a treaty for construction of a dam on the Mahakali river, which originates in Kalapani. The Mahakali river forms Nepal's western border with its huge neighbour.
Nepal says the river originated from a point west of Kalapani. An Indian security post is located in Kalapani, and analysts say Kathmandu wants the post removed if it is found to lie on Nepali soil.
The dispute must be settled before a detailed project report is prepared for the new dam, which will generate 6,000 megawatts of hydroelectric power to be shared equally by the two countries.
The joint border panel is due to resolve the matter within a month.
